ygData.subject: Re: Diety Question and a Warning
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Well, I went agnostic with my bard so I couldn t comment on BARDS and their dieties. The only problem I EVER had with non-evil race merchants was the
ygData.messageBody:
> Anyway, on to my question. How much does a diety effect your actual
>abilities
>and inter-race relations? I play a Wood Elf bard, and have enjoyed it
>immensly,
>but chose my diety as Tunare for fear of fraction problems. I roleplay my
>character as a romantic, so naturally Erolisi Marr (sp?) seems like a good
>choice, but I am unsure of it's effects on others. Would love to hear from
>another bard who has tried more than one diety perhaps.
>
>Laeaus, Wood Elf Bard level...(sigh)...3

Well, I went agnostic with my bard so I couldn't comment on BARDS and their
dieties. The only problem I EVER had with non-evil race merchants was the
non-half-elf spell merchants in Qeynos wizard guild not wanting to talk to
me EVER. I kinda took pride in my charisma and my party liked to have me buy
their things at a better rate. Anyways, I do have an example of a non-bard
class making a diety choice that affects faction. I had a gnome necromancer
acquaintance who didn't have much problem with any merchants because he went
agnostic instead of choosing an evil diety (as many do). He tried playing a
gnome necro before that with an evil diety as patron, and had problems. I
don't know if this is still the case in the current state of Everquest.

Sartori of Kelethin
